title: Fundamentals of Wireless Communication Beamforming Design: Machine Learning-Enabled Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational linear algebra, probability concepts, and basic Python programming skills
context.additional_context: Practical training in establishing multi-user wireless communication scenarios in VR environments and optimizing beamforming parameters.

learning_goals: Learners can explain fundamental beamforming principles (maximal ratio transmission, zero-forcing) in multi-user interference channel environments.
Learners can simulate beamforming weight optimization processes using deep learning neural networks.
Learners can mathematically model and evaluate beamforming design problems considering channel vectors and power constraints.
It is possible to comparatively analyze the performance (sum rate) of machine learning-based beamforming design with conventional methods.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
